==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|み|こ|yomi=kun}}
{{ja-kanjitab|お|こ|yomi=kun}}

===Etymology 1===
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=み}} {{m|ja|御|tr=mi||spirit, god}} plus {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=こ}} {{m|ja|子|tr=ko||boy, child}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|みこ}}

# A [[god]]'s or [[spirit]]'s [[child]].
# An [[emperor]]'s child.
# [[Jesus Christ]].

===Etymology 2===
From {{m|ja|御|tr=o|pos=''honorific prefix''}} + {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=こ}} {{m|ja|子|tr=ko||boy, child}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|おこ}}

# {{lb|ja|honorific}} A child; especially the [[addressee]]'s child.
#* 　御子様ランチ (''okosama ranchi'', "child's lunch")

=====Usage notes=====
* More often the first element is written in [[hiragana]], as {{m|ja|お子}}.
